blogPosts.title: CI/CD to Azure VM with GitHub Actions, Python, and Nginx
blogPosts.excerpt: Learn how I set up a full CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions to deploy a FastAPI app on an Azure VM, complete with systemd service and Nginx reverse proxy.
blogPosts.content:
üöÄ Introduction

In this blog, I‚Äôll walk you through how I set up a CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions to deploy a Python API hosted on an Azure VM. We‚Äôll also cover how to run the app as a service with systemd and expose it to the web securely via an Nginx reverse proxy.

üß∞ Tools & Stack

  • GitHub Actions
  • Azure VM (Ubuntu)
  • FastAPI + Uvicorn
  • Python 3.10
  • Alembic (for migrations)
  • Systemd
  • Nginx

üîê Step 1: Set Up Azure VM

Create an Ubuntu VM on Azure and open necessary ports (22 for SSH, 80 and 443 for web). SSH into the VM:

ssh azureuser@your-vm-ip

Create a user and directory

sudo adduser deployuser
sudo mkdir -p /home/deployuser/app
sudo chown -R deployuser:deployuser /home/deployuser/app

üêç Step 2: Clone and Set Up Your FastAPI App

cd /home/deployuser/app
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/donatehub-api.git
cd donatehub-api
python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt

üîÑ Step 3: Create a systemd Service

Create a systemd service to run your app:

sudo nano /etc/systemd/system/donatehub-app.service
[Unit]
Description=DonateHub API
After=network.target

[Service]
User=deployuser
WorkingDirectory=/home/deployuser/app/donatehub-api
ExecStart=/home/deployuser/app/donatehub-api/venv/bin/uvicorn app.main:app --host 127.0.0.1 --port 8000
Restart=always

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target

Enable and start the service:

sudo systemctl daemon-reexec
sudo systemctl enable donatehub-app.service
sudo systemctl start donatehub-app.service

üåê Step 4: Set Up Nginx Reverse Proxy

Install and configure Nginx:

sudo apt update
sudo apt install nginx

Create a new server block:

sudo nano /etc/nginx/sites-available/donatehub
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name yourdomain.com;

    location / {
        proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:8000;
        proxy_set_header Host $host;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    }
}

Enable and restart Nginx:

sudo ln -s /etc/nginx/sites-available/donatehub /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/
sudo nginx -t
sudo systemctl restart nginx

ü§ñ Step 5: Create GitHub Actions Workflow

Add a .github/workflows/deploy.yaml file:

name: Deploy to AZURE

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - deployment

jobs:
  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.10"

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: |
          pip install -r requirements.txt

      - name: Deploy via SSH
        uses: appleboy/ssh-action@v1.0.0
        with:
          host: ${{ secrets.AZURE_VM_IP }}
          username: ${{ secrets.AZURE_VM_USER }}
          key: ${{ secrets.GCP_SSH_KEY }}
          script: |
            cd /home/${{ secrets.AZURE_VM_USER }}/app/donatehub-api
            git pull origin deployment
            source venv/bin/activate
            pip install -r requirements.txt
            alembic upgrade head
            sudo systemctl restart donatehub-app.service

üîê Step 6: Add GitHub Secrets

  • AZURE_VM_IP ‚Äì Your Azure VM public IP
  • AZURE_VM_USER ‚Äì Your SSH username
  • GCP_SSH_KEY ‚Äì Your SSH private key (no passphrase)

‚úÖ Conclusion

You now have a robust CI/CD pipeline that:

  • Deploys your FastAPI app automatically
  • Handles dependencies and DB migrations
  • Restarts your service via systemd
  • Is exposed to the world via Nginx

This setup is reliable, secure, and ideal for real-world deployments. üöÄ
